website_summaries.verdict: It has some issues related to the soft spout and tends to leak. But the design is great at preventing colic if you can deal with these concerns.
pros: Removable handle and sturdy, snap-tight lid
4-ounce size is ideal for small hands and the youngest learners
cons: Some toddlers chew too hard on the spout, causing damage
Must be tilted just right for adequate flow

customer_reviews.title: Made things worse
customer_reviews.text: My baby never, ever bit me while nursing. Then she started using this sippy cup. It was so difficult for her to get water out that she started biting and chewing on the end. I tested the cup out myself and the suction required to get liquid out is difficult, even for me as the adult. Soon, she started biting me while nursing. I immediately stopped giving her this sippy cup and now she doesn't bite me while nursing anymore. I'm not positive they are correlated, but it seems likely.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Life saver!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 month old refuses all bottles and pacifiers. He loves this transition cup! Now I can be away from my baby for longer than 2 hours because I know he can eat.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Dominis

customer_reviews.title: Nothing else worked
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers my exclusively breastfed son would not take ANY bottle. I spent hundreds on store brand to expensive brands of bottles and nothing worked until I purchased these. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Zoe

customer_reviews.title: Nursing Mom's best friend!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 month old daughter was exclusively breastfed and HATED bottles. I bought this cup because another mom mentioned it on Babycenter. She LOVES this and I am FREE!!! Seriously I can now go on a date with my hubby without coming back home halfway through to nurse. It did take her about 4 days to really get the hang of it so don't discouraged if you don't have immediate success like some of the other parents on here.
customer_reviews.author: iheartcookbooks

customer_reviews.title: I couldnt be happier. Also this cup is $10 everywhere else i ...
customer_reviews.text: Mira-frickin-cle. Seriously a miracle. My son would never even attempt to drink from a bottle. He would just push everything out with his tongue. At most he'd chew on the nipple a bit but never drink anything. My son is a bit younger than the recomended age for this. Hes not even 3 months yet, But i didnt want to try yet another bottle so we skipped the munchkin latch bottle and went straight to this. I couldnt be happier. Also this cup is $10 everywhere else i saw it. So for sure purchase here as an add on and pay less than half the price you would anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: E.B. white

customer_reviews.title: It belongs in the trash
customer_reviews.text: First week was usable, then it kept leaking and leaking. I got fed up with it when it leaked from the bottom all over inside the diaper bag and threw it away. The avent or Nuk transitional ones are so much better and haven't had issues with leaks, and we've been using them from 6 months now.
customer_reviews.author: A. A

customer_reviews.title: Attention IT'S GREAT for Breastfeeding Babies or thoes babies who want use a bottle
customer_reviews.text: Ok Attention Attention!!!❤😄 For those breast feed infants that only want their moms breast this cup is absolutely a lifesaver My 5mth old granddaughter only wants her moms breast we've tried EVERY bottle out there even some syringes and spoons she wouldn't take milk from anything except this cup!! Each child is different not saying it'll work for your baby but Thank God its working for ours!!
customer_reviews.author: Quiana Jones

customer_reviews.title: Baby refuses any other "bottle"
customer_reviews.text: I second all the moms on here that say their baby hated bottles but would drink from this! Looks like this may be a life changer!
customer_reviews.author: ccash

customer_reviews.title: Seems great, but bottom valve leaked
customer_reviews.text: My 7 mo old loved this cup for learning to sip water when eating. Easy for him to drink and he was starting to learn how to hold it. However, we had two of them and both started leaking out of the bottom valve after a week or so. I tried pushing the valve in farther, then tried pulling it out slightly - no dice either way. Puddle of water wherever it sat on the counter. It seems like these are good quality, and it doesn’t look like too many other folks had this issue (and we were 2 for 2), so I’m stumped. Wish we’d had better luck.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great transitioning sippy cup
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I bought this for my 6month old breastfed baby he hated regular baby bottles with the normal nipple he could never get anything out and would just chew on the nipple. This was a nobrainer for him he immediately knew what to do the more he clamps down on it the more that comes out so I would suggest putting a bib on before giving your baby this because it will come out fast my baby has no problem getting his drink out of this. Now at 7 months he still uses this and is his favorite cup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Life Changer
customer_reviews.text: This cup worked miracles for my 3 month old who refuses pacifiers and bottles. I spent a small fortune on different types of bottles and was at my wits end. It was to the point that I was thinking I may not be able to go back to work. I will add that my son has a lip and tongue tie that we can’t have corrected until he’s 4 months old.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend / top notch customer service
customer_reviews.text: This was the only “bottle” my son would take. He only liked it “from the tap” and refused any bottle I’d try. (I tried 4 different ones) I found this one and read similar reviews of moms having the same trouble. Well- he loves it and will drink my milk from it at grandma’s while I work. Such a blessing. Plus, munchkin’s customer service is top notch. I wanted more mouth pieces bc I had bought the bottle set with nipples, and wanted more sippy cup mouthpieces. They are sending me a complimentary cup! How amazing. Very impressed and would recommend this! - happy mom of 5
customer_reviews.author: Good Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Baby finally took a bottle/cup!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't try "every bottle" out there, like many of these other reviewers claim, but this was probably the 5th one I tried. When my exclusively breastfed baby was about 6 1/2 months, he finally was able to drink from this as I figured I'd lean more towards sippy cups at that age and bypass bottles. Yay! When he first drank from it, I thought to myself I'D GIVE IT 6 STARS IF I COULD, OMG. Haha.
customer_reviews.author: melissa holland

customer_reviews.title: Awesome transition cup!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a cup that mimicked a bottle nipple, and this one was perfect. My 9 month old had only held his bottle on his own once. He can do it, he just doesn't like to. I gave him the cup, held it for a drink once, just so he would learn what it was, and he grabbed it and put it to his mouth almost immediately. I was surprised! He's still learning that he needs to tip it up to get a drink, but it's only been 2 days. I haven't noticed any leaks just by tipping it upside down, but time will tell. I'm totally satisfied with this cup!
customer_reviews.author: JBunx7257

customer_reviews.title: Our feeding saving grace
customer_reviews.text: We had so many issues with bottles and cups with his feeding difficulties that I never thought we’d find a bottle Jude would take to. Finally found the munchkin latch and I have never been so pleased! The nipple moves with the baby to allow a more natural breastfeeding experience. The handles allowed Jude to hold his bottle (and now sippycup) with independence and ease. I also love that the nipples are interchangeable so when we were done using it as a bottle I could put the sippy cup nipple I nand it was the same bottle he loved still!
customer_reviews.author: Miranda E.

customer_reviews.title: This sippy cup works well. It's frustrating that Munchkin ...
customer_reviews.text: This sippy cup works well. It's frustrating that Munchkin won't sell the parts to this separately so you can just convert your baby bottles to sippy cups. The cup itself is exactly their 4oz Latch bottle, which a different nipple and the handles on the bottom to clip on. Why not sell the handle and nipple separately? I have lots of 4oz bottles that I could repurpose, but no, just buy more!
customer_reviews.author: Juan L. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Good but hazard
customer_reviews.text: I loved this cup at first. My son didn’t like most sippy cups but he liked this one. However I hate the blue plug at the bottom of the cup. It comes out and he has put it in his mouth twice now, it is a choking hazard. I have other munchkin cups that he associates only with water so I liked this one was clear he could see the milk, but the plug comes out of the cup so he can spill all the milk out and as soon as he is done he flips it over and pulls it out and sticks it in his mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Nattyb

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: My baby wouldn’t take any bottle or cup but we tried but finally, this she loved! Ahh hello sanity! Every little one is different but she liked the wide nipple and that it moves around and is less stationary than other cups or bottles. She’s one now and still loves to drink milk from this when she’s sleepy. It’s super easy to clean and so affordable. I wish I tried this first before the other expensive bottles and sippy cups! Love love love.
customer_reviews.author: Marambos

customer_reviews.title: Better than Others
customer_reviews.text: We tried to use this as a bottle alternative for our child that would not take bottles at daycare. It...kind of worked. 6 month old loves holding it and chewing on the spout and will sometimes drink from it. Overall, didn't work for us a bottle replacement, but we are holding onto it as a regular sippy cup. It definitely seems much better on the teeth/mouth than the hard spouted cups you hear horror stories about. It is also easy to clean, minus the anti-colic thing at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: M9772

customer_reviews.title: Great ”sippy”cup when going from bottle to cup
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my youngest grandson who is slowly transitioning from the bottle to a cup. They had tried other sappy cups but he was just not getting the hang of it. Munchkin Latch bottles are what he is using now so it just made sense to try the sippy cup and I’m happy to say he’s getting the hang of it. This cup is really well made, very durable and so far can survive a toddler dropping it on tile floor 9 million times. Happy grandson = Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Roxymama

customer_reviews.title: Be careful- MOLD
customer_reviews.text: At first, I really liked this product as it appeared to be a good introductory cup for my daughter. Unfortunately, after leaving water in it overnight, I went to dump out the water in it and clean it, and noticed a small mold spot in the silicone nipple piece. I cleaned it with hot soapy water, ran it in the sanitizer, and let it air dry. After a day or 2, I decided to use the cup again (water) and the very next day, the same silicone part was COVERED with mold. So had to throw away- not happy :( Note: I only ever used it for cold water, no juice, milk, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi M.

customer_reviews.title: Good for younger babies
customer_reviews.text: My baby liked this cup when she was smaller and just learning how to use a cup. The spout and top are very supple and soft. The handle piece is weird, and falls off every time she drops the cup - which is annoying. Also, now that she is older (14 months), the likes to push the rubber spout completely into the cup and dump the water everywhere. So, this cup's time has come to go into the closet. It was (mostly) good while it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for babies first
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 7 months and she loves this cup. We only put water in it when she is eating her baby food, but its so easy for her to hold. She turn that thing upside down and beats the bottom of it and not once has it leaked. Because we give it to her with her baby food she does get food in and around the top and now its orange stained, but that's probably from the carrots. I typically boil the top once a week with her bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Vadams

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to get anything out!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how this is supposed to work but my 5 month old son that can sip from a regular cup and empties a breast in less than 5 minutes cannot get anything out of it. I tried it myself and it seems your supposed to bite and suck hard at the same time to get anything out, not easy at all, let alone for a baby. I don't know how other people are saying that this is better than the regular bottle but I guess babies are different. My son has no problems with bottles or the breast, I just wanted to try this to transition him to a sippy cup for dinnertime drinking but didn't work..
customer_reviews.author: Ene-Liis teppo

customer_reviews.title: Great transition sippy cup.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to transition my daughter out of drinking from a bottle. Although she drinks from cups with out without a straw, when it came to milk she just wanted her bottle. I purchased other sippy cups but the nipple would collapse when she sucked on it and she wouldn't get milk out at the rate she liked. This one is perfect because of the vent, which helps with that issue. I have never used this brand before but I’m happy I gave it a try. My daughter loves it and I love that it easy to clean. I do wish the handles were removable but other than that I’m satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: yasmine

customer_reviews.title: Works well if assembled correctly
customer_reviews.text: I think the biggest point here is making sure the the silicone spout part is pulled all the way up and set into place in the bottle after assembling. It will feel like you are pulling it too far through... too far and it pulls all the way through, just enough and it sets into place and seals. My 1 year old son has an easy time handling this and drinking from it. I'd recommend this to anyone transitioning from bottle to cup.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great for my breastfed baby!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on bottles and cups for my 7 month old (who refuses a bottle no matter who is trying to give it to him). Rather than continuing to try bottles, then having to break him of the bottle habit later on, I tried this transition cup and he took to it right away! This cup is awesome! All pieces come off and cleaning it is very simple. Minimal leakage unless the baby is hitting it against something. Definitely recommend this cup, especially for breastfed babies!
customer_reviews.author: Cameo

customer_reviews.title: Only sippy cup my daughter would take!
customer_reviews.text: I breastfed my daughter for 9 months before getting pregnant with twins and my milk completely dried up very quickly. After several days of dry diapers and trying almost every brand of bottle, we finally found this and thought we could try it instead of a bottle. This sippy cup was the only thing she would accept and she caught on quickly! Such a relief to finally have her drinking milk again even though it couldn't come from me!
customer_reviews.author: Piper

customer_reviews.title: Only thing that worked when every bottle failed me...
customer_reviews.text: This is the only thing I could get my daughter to take when I went back to work when she was 5 months. I really wanted to use something glass but I tried Tommy Tippee, Dr. Brown's, Evenflow, Comotomo and she rejected everything but took this sippy with ease. I really like the handles on this since it makes it so easy for my daughter to grasp. I was able to transition her to the Green Sprouts Glass Sippy cup after 2 months but this thing saved me.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Scott

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hype
customer_reviews.text: Received this bottle yesterday, sterilized it via dishwasher and it melted. I really wanted to like this product. It sure seems appealing with the anit-colic valve and the extended spout. When taking it apart, there were too many pieces. Plus the handles are hard plastic, not ideal for a 7 month old who wants to chew on everything. I'd like a refund!
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Good first sippy cup
customer_reviews.text: Baby is breastfed and stopped taking bottle at 4 months but loves this sippy cup! Good to learn on and easy to hold (Nuk spout is hard and baby has to tip head way back and miracle cup was too advanced for our 6 month old to figure out). Spout is nice and soft and bends with baby so they don't have to tip their head back so far. Valve makes for extra cleaning but not much and helps with gassiness so it's worth it! Nice gender neutral color so we can use for next kiddo too! Favorite first sippy cup!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My picky baby loves it
customer_reviews.text: Dislikes- it leaks if you tip it upsidown which my son figured out so he makes puddles on his highchair tray. The handle pops off of dropped so we ended up loosing the handles for a little. If not all the way dry it will start to mold in between the bumpy part of the nipple so beware!! Likes- it has a soft spout and was the first cup my son would take, it’s still on of his preferred cups. I like that you can move the handles to make it easier for baby to drink/learn to use it.
customer_reviews.author: A321

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning and Maintenence problems make this a not so great product. Wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I got this cup for my baby and she really liked it from the beginning and uses it till date.But its more of a maintenance problem in terms of cleaning the dirt that gets accumulated at the top of the rings in the cup.I dono how "Black dirt" gets there every single time when we use it.Due to this am afraid to even recommend this to any baby. I was hoping Munchkin would bring a better product but this one is worse.Please DO NOT BUY .
customer_reviews.author: Nerukkadi

customer_reviews.title: My little one loves it
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is 8 months old. We first tried the Munchkin 360 sippy cup. She learned to use it quickly but doesn't seem to be interested in using it much. So I bought this one for her, since it's a easier transition from bottles. My daughter likes it! She drinks a larger volume of liquid from it, and likes to play with it like a chew toy after drinking. The transparent body also makes it easier to see how much is left in it. I would recommend it to other parents.
customer_reviews.author: N. Jiang

customer_reviews.title: Worth a try but not for teething, biting babies
customer_reviews.text: Pros: nice handle Cons: The flexible spout sprayed out liquid every time baby dropped it. You do have to ensure you pull the plastic spout ridges all the way through Or you’ll get leakage too. Definitely better for kids that aren’t teething. Our son bites and pulls everything out of his mouth so this cup lasted less than two weeks before he ripped through the spout, tearing a larger drinking hole than needed.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: He likes to chew on the tip since he’s teething so I’m happy that it is soft
customer_reviews.text: Baby loves this cup! He likes to chew on the tip since he’s teething so I’m happy that it is soft. For the parents that say that it is hard for their baby to sip out of because of the small holes I would say give it some time, my baby was having a hard time too but after a little while he realizes he had to kind of bite on to it to really get the water out. Now he plays around with it and drinks water all by himself. He has two cups and I can tell he prefers this one over the other one.
customer_reviews.author: JesseW

customer_reviews.title: Cup is a hit and easy for baby to grasp the idea
customer_reviews.text: Really the only bottle that my daughter knows how to use, and she gets so excited when she sees it! It’s a great cup for transitioning from bottle. I think she loves to chew on the soppy part! Her therapist said because the top is big so it gives her a lot of sensory input and she’s a sensory seeker. She also has low muscle tone or hypotonia so her gross motor and fine motor skills are some what delayed and learning how to use a cup is more difficult than it would be for the neurological baby.
customer_reviews.author: didi sun

customer_reviews.title: Baby’s favorite cup!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has various brands of sippy cups, and this is definitely her favorite. It’s got a pretty easy flow, which means it can leak if the cup is left with the mouthpiece squished against something. However, I definitely think it’s the best for mealtime because she can easily get a good amount of liquid to wash her food down. Sidenote, my daughter is almost one.
customer_reviews.author: 4fromTexas

customer_reviews.title: Neon orange
customer_reviews.text: So here’s the thing: in the photos it looks just regular orange, but in reality it’s bright neon orange. Not sure what Munchkin was thinking. The orange is not cute but the product is perfect. The spout is soft silicone for sensitive baby gums. And the instructions even say not to boil or sterilize! Just wash! Which makes my life so much easier. Thank you for an amazing product! I would just nix the neon orange.
customer_reviews.author: annette828

customer_reviews.title: Baby approved
customer_reviews.text: Our 7 month old just started using a sippy and he does quite well with this one. It is really leak proof when he's holding it upside down or throwing it around. My only complaint is that it seems somewhat difficult for him to get liquid out of it. I tried to use it myself and you do have to suck pretty hard. But it's not so difficult that he can't use it, he definitely can get the liquid out if he really wants to.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Lobeda

customer_reviews.title: Breastfeeding friendly cup!
customer_reviews.text: My little one is exclusively breastfed and has never used a bottle. Now that she is older I was wanting to have her use a bottle but as I was reading I realized she could try a cup but I wanted one that was easy to clean, helps with gassiness, and would transition from BF to cup and back well. This cup is PERFECT for all of these! Highly recommend for all babies but very helpful for the transition back and forth from BF! Also she loves holding the little handles and does great to “self” feed with the cup.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: My son liked it
customer_reviews.text: My son liked this sippy when he first transitioned to sippys. After he started getting better and using sippys, we started to use this less because he has to suck pretty hard to chug his drink. I like the venting system on the bottom, it is in there pretty tight though so I'm a little skeptical of how effective it is. All in all, it was a great learning sippy cup.
customer_reviews.author: trishh12

customer_reviews.title: Decent Sippy
customer_reviews.text: Decent early sippy cup we used to introduce exclusively breastfed baby to. We skipped bottles and went straight to this when our baby turned 6 months. It leaks a little when held upside down and the flow is still a bit too fast for her even now at 8 months old now. I do like the spout that tilts around though and will be keeping this sippy until we transition to something else since we do not use it much anyways.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Only Sippy Cup My Son Will Use
customer_reviews.text: We were given some other brands of sippy cups as baby gifts and he will only use this one. Update: Originally rated 5 stars but changing rating because almost every single one of the rings has cracked (see picture) making the entire cup unusable. My son was extremely easy on these cups and didn’t really throw or drop them so it must be a manufacturing issue. One of them only lasted a couple weeks, the rest a few months. The blue air inlet at the bottom leaks, too. Can’t use!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Love love love! Doesn’t leak and my daughter got the hang of it right away! She’s EBF (doesn’t drink milk from a bottle) but she gets excited when she sees this cup to drink water! It doesn’t leak anywhere and doesn’t choke when drinking it. I skipped the bottle and went straight to this with no problems
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up from my 11 month old
customer_reviews.text: Great cup for transitioning! My 11 month is so picky. He’s been picky with pacifiers, bottles, anything and it’s a fight but he took to this cup right away. Some cups are really hard to can get anything out of them because you need to bite down, but my son can get water out of this cup with no difficulty and it is truly leak proof!
customer_reviews.author: courtney williams

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't leak
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because of the lid. Have been trying to teach 11 month old that I babysit to use cup. The one his mom brought me has hard mouth piece & he doesn't know what to do with it. First time with the soft mouth piece & was drinking like a champ. Mommy was so happy.... now to get him to stop trying to teach my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine J Page

customer_reviews.title: A Fabulous First Sippy Cup!
customer_reviews.text: When your breastfed baby won't take a bottle from anyone and then you finally try this LATCH Transition Cup and he drinks pumped milk from it you, too, will LOVE this cup! Buy it. It works. It's great.
customer_reviews.author: ChrissyCars

customer_reviews.title: Baby has to bite down and suck on the valve to get anything out
customer_reviews.text: There are two valves in the spout of this cup which prevent leaking. I tried it myself and you have to bite down and suck to get anything out. This cup is a good size and the handles are great but my son tips it up and can't get any liquid out and just chews on the spout (8 mo old). We've had more success with the Philips Avent trainer which has a slit in the spout instead of valves.
customer_reviews.author: eli

customer_reviews.title: I've LOVED all of the munchkin latch products so far
customer_reviews.text: I've LOVED all of the munchkin latch products so far. This has been the best sippy we've tried. The only bummer is that because of the design, it smashes her little nose while she is drinking so she has to keep stopping to breathe.
customer_reviews.author: CarolynTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: My baby denied using Tomme Tippee's sippy top but was ok right away with this. Higher quality I would say. Honestly I just got this because Muchkin doesn't sell just the handle for those bottles. We were ok with just nipple tops (no sippy). But it's good that my baby loves everything about them. This is her only brand.
customer_reviews.author: LTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Plug in bottom - not revolutionary.
customer_reviews.text: Handles could be skinnier for smaller hands. This cup has a plug in the bottom that comes out I assume for easy cleaning. I have poured valuable breast milk into this cup now a couple times and had it pour out everywhere because the plug wasn’t put i. the bottom. The design is not revolutionary, but one that makes a single element invaluable to the use of the device. Without it, if lost, destroyed, or simply forgotten, the cup is useless. Flow rate is high.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Babcock

customer_reviews.title: No replacement lids available to buy 😞
customer_reviews.text: You can’t buy replacement parts for the latch. The mouth piece cracked on mine, so now the cup is worthless. The nuk allows you to buy replacement mouthpieces. The nuk is great because if my dog gets ahold of it and chews the lid off I can order more on prime. Also my kiddo likes to push the mouth piece inward and it causes the milk to Spill out
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too much suction required for my cleft palate baby
customer_reviews.text: The cup was absolutely leak proof and I really liked the design of the flexible top. However, the suction required to get liquid out was extremely high. I was testing for myself with only water and it was difficult for me and I knew how to work it. Unfortunately, this would not work for my cleft palate baby as even the biting/chewing would not produce liquids.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Nice bottles but LEAKS ALL THE TIME
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about the munchkin bottles except that they just leak all the time! I’m constantly having to mess with the blue valve on the bottom so that it doesn’t leak. I literally have a poking tool next to his bottles because I have to poke at it to stop the leaks every day! So annoying!! But I am stuck with 7 bottles and don’t want to spend more money on new bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Sofia I

customer_reviews.title: I Don't Get the Hype
customer_reviews.text: This thing has six parts. SIX PARTS. It's a sippy cup, for crying out loud. My one-year-old doesn't even like it, and it's so complicated to clean and dry and put back together, I don't use it. If you're looking for the old-style sippy cup that has a body and a lid and that's it... Ikea still has them.
customer_reviews.author: R. Ames

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For My 4 Month Old! Easy To Clean!
customer_reviews.text: I tried 3 different type of cups for my 4 months old who refused the bottle if he saw his big brother with a cup! This was the perfect cup because the spout is flexible! His coordination is still not great so the flexible spout allows him to keep it in his mouth. The handles are perfect for his little hands and I love that there is a spout that comes out the bottom for easy cleaning!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: NO REPLACEMENT NIPPLES SOLD
customer_reviews.text: I should have read the Q&A section and not just the reviews because this cup has no extra nipples/spouts!!! The spout accidentally got burned by a hot pot; I searched Amazon and the web with no luck. So I went to the Q&A and it shows that has been a consistent issue for three years and Munkin has done nothing to resolve the lack of product availability during that time. They have another transition cup without the bottom valve that uses the same spout but I will not be buying that either. If anything happens I have to buy a whole new cup just to get spout. RIDICULOUS!
customer_reviews.author: THale

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has a toung / upper lip tie. This is the only brand of bottle she can use (still some spills, but overall best brand) these transition cups are interchangeable with the nipples of the regular bottle and the handles pop off to use on the regular bottles so great for teaching her to hold it on her own! Because they fit on the regular munchkin latch bottles you can put it on the 8oz ones when baby girl wants 6/8 oz of formula or juice (watered down of course)
customer_reviews.author: Lizzy9534

customer_reviews.title: Great for breastfed babies that will not take a bottle!
customer_reviews.text: I could not get my exclusively breastfed baby to take a bottle and lord knows I tried every bottle. Even the ones that should mimick the breast. He was not going to be fooled. I read somewhere that with babies such as my son to try a transition sippy cup instead. He LOVES this cup. My mother in law was able to give him milk out of it and he took it no problem. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: S. OGrady

customer_reviews.title: Another miracle!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried so many bottles for my baby- and she hated every nipple!!! I tried this transitional cup because I read the reviews and I now feel soooo relieved because my baby won't starve when I go back to work in a few weeks. And just as a pointer for other mommas, I tried this cup at around 3.5 months and she didn't quite get it, but now she is a little over 4 months and can get 3+ ounces of milk in a relatively short amount of time! Yippee!!!! Thanks Munchkin!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Not for breastfed babies! Baby became a biter
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to use this bottle because it flows quicker than regular and it supposedly helps to transition to a soppy cup. But my breastfed baby started biting my nipples when latching and she has some teeth. Ouch! So we haven’t used it ever since. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Bermet Suominen

customer_reviews.title: A must for bottle-refusing babies!
customer_reviews.text: 4 month old loves this! It’s the first thing she’s taken other than breast. It’s easy for her to use, the spout moves freely, it’s amazing. And clearly well made bc somehow it just made sense to her right away! She knew what to do and finds it fun! Win-win!
customer_reviews.author: melissa s.

customer_reviews.title: Only cup my nursing baby would take!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a stubborn one year old. We literally have tried every sippy/bottle combination since she was born. She took to this cup right away! It has made weaning a breeze. Especially with the great price! Only bummer for me is so far i've only found this cup on amazon, so keep back ups!
customer_reviews.author: Julie Pingel

customer_reviews.title: Latch was the only "bottle" our baby would take
customer_reviews.text: My baby wouldn't take a bottle so the latch was a life saver! He started using the latch at around 4-4.5 months and is still using it at just under a year. I do wish you could just buy the sippy cup nipples without having to buy the whole bottle too. For us it is totally worth it however!
customer_reviews.author: Raquel Frisch

customer_reviews.title: Baby actually likes it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this cup. It’s easy for my baby to use. Oh complaint is that he handles are weird since they are on the bottom of the cup. But that is a personal prefernace. We couldn’t get our, at the time, 6 month old to take bottles. So I stopped trying and thought maybe she would take a sippy up. She did! She loves it. Very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Xavier Hogan

customer_reviews.title: This has been working fine for my son
customer_reviews.text: This has been working fine for my son. It hasn't worked any better or worse than any other cup. He is 6 months old and is not a huge fan of water yet...he can get the water out but he doesn't drink it yet so that is not a reflection of the product. I have not noticed a different in have the valve at the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for transition
customer_reviews.text: We've tried a few different sippys for my daughter. She used the latch bottles after she was done nursing so when all the other sippys failed us, I found this. Works like a charm! she picked it right up and could drink from it right away because it has the soft top.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean but not totally spill proof
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean but not totally spill proof. My son loves to shake this cup and the water rains out around him. The ring around the spout is pretty thin so it cracked after a couple throws. The handle piece has held together well. This was one of the first transition cups we bought and he took right to it without any issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for nursing babies
customer_reviews.text: This transition cup has been the only cup my baby girl who has been exclusively breastfed will take. She is 10 months old and she began drinking a little water throughout the day at 9 months and we tried many bottles & cups before we landed on this one. It has been a game changer! Definitely recommend to mamas of breastfed babies!
customer_reviews.author: BusyMomma

customer_reviews.title: Seamless transition for baby
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect transition cup for us. We used the Munchkin Latch bottles, so it was the natural choice. Our pediatrician told us to start trying to give him a sippy around 4 months. (Yeah right--so we thought) he did great with this! He picked it up easily. It seemed like a natural transition to a sippy for him. We had other brands, but this was the one he always drank the most from. He just liked it more.
customer_reviews.author: Nicky

customer_reviews.title: Bottom valve leaks
customer_reviews.text: My LO loves this cup, however after maybe 5 uses the valve in the bottom started to leak. Useless now. For an expensive cup like this I expect it to last more than a few uses! Save your money and buy the one that doesn’t have the valve!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally something my bf baby will use!!!!
customer_reviews.text: After 8 mo, over 20 bottles & sippy cups tried and so much money wasted....we finally found the ONLY ONE our breastfed daughter could latch on & drink from. The handles on the bottom (finally! Someone gets it!) are perfect for little ones to easily lift high enough to get a drink. Colic valve so my little one is happy! No leaking unless the soft nipple is squeezed. I immediately ordered another one!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Not for babies 8 months and under basically.
customer_reviews.text: The bottle is nice but the top piece is just something he wants to play with and the handles are easy to grab for him but he doesn't know to lift let. So anyone under 7 months shouldn't buy this. We have been teaching him to drink milk out of a small medicine cap and has been working very well. The sippy cups like these don't get the job accomplished and just allows them to have an item in their mouth to play with. Don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: Bohemian Gal

customer_reviews.title: Give this a chance!
customer_reviews.text: If you have tried every sippy out there and haven't tried this, give it a chance! I bought this for my newphew because my sister had tried every other one out there from cheap to expensive. He just turned one and has been struggling with sippy cups for months now even though he is weaning. He transitioned to this the first try and is now finally able use a sippy without making a huge mess. I can't comment on cleaning it since it was a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Al D.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work for us
customer_reviews.text: Read great reviews so I ordered it but I don’t like this cup. My toddler couldn’t use it at first bcz she needed teeth to squeeze the juice out. She’s a late tether. But I tried again and now she likes to turn it upside down & squeeze the top on her tray and spills all the liquid out all over
customer_reviews.author: epl

customer_reviews.title: My Bottle-Refusing Baby Drinks from This!
customer_reviews.text: My exclusively breastfed 4.5 month old has NEVER taken a bottle despite trying every different kind on the market. Finally, with 2 weeks left before I have to leave him with a nanny to go back to work, I ordered this sippy cup in desperation of finding some way for her to feed him. Somehow after never figuring out how to latch on a bottle nipple, he instantly was able to drink from this and even tries to hold it himself! He still dribbles about half of the milk out, but that should improve with practice and at least he’s getting SOMETHING while I’m away. If you also have a baby that won’t take a bottle - try this!
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Great transition cup
customer_reviews.text: This was the first cup our daughter was able to actually get liquid out of. Highly recommend as a transition cup. She seems to really like drinking out of this cup. Only downside is it does not fit in the cup holder area of a high chair because the handles come from the bottom, but not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin G.

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect. Functions. Not for chewers.
customer_reviews.text: Baby bit through nipple easily. Dog chewed first nipple. No where to buy just the nipples. Too many parts to clean. No leak proof. Baby found way to bang it just rt on a hard surface to make a mess. Cool design. Needs so easy tweaks.
customer_reviews.author: Mfoojuri

customer_reviews.title: Easier for baby to hold
customer_reviews.text: I love this product so much I bought another one. Its so much easier for my baby to hold with this handle position. It made all the difference. This was an easier transition from the breast to a sippie cup. Unlike the other brands,my baby was able to hold this independently.
customer_reviews.author: N.B

customer_reviews.title: Favorite first cup of breast fed baby
customer_reviews.text: Breastfed baby easily and readily used this cup when uninterested in bottles. The spout is soft and flexible and very easy to latch on to. I find the flow to be a little faster than other soft spouted sippy cups but my baby had no issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: WACK
customer_reviews.text: leaky af!! also the nipple part ripped open after only several uses I don't recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. D

customer_reviews.title: Daughter Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter quit taking a bottle but loves this sippy cup so it was a perfect replacement. She can hold it well, it holds the right amount and doesn't have hidden crevices for mold to grow. It does leak through the mouth piece when hit upsdie down. I know this is not "proper use" but it does happen with a one year old!
customer_reviews.author: Kate Williams

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to get anything
customer_reviews.text: They seemed like great sippy cups based on reviews and such but now that I have them I don't think so. They're definitely leak proof... but also suck proof. My daughter was getting so frustrated and I couldn't figure out why until I tried to suck liquid from them myself. It actually hurt from sucking so hard just to get a few drops of water out. Going to try spoutless now. Sippy cups are a no go.
customer_reviews.author: PrincessA

customer_reviews.title: There is no replacement nipple
customer_reviews.text: The cup is very convenient, however, there is no nipple replacement which means that if your kid is like mine and is in the stage of nibbling everything on his path, you're in for a waste of your money. The cup will become useless after that.
customer_reviews.author: Yazmin S. Macias-Quintana

customer_reviews.title: Great cup for a picky little boy
customer_reviews.text: I've gone threw every bottle known to man and my son wont use it I've gone threw a bunch of cups but this one my son will drink from. It doesnt leak is easy to clean. Hes able to hold it with one hand or both. The only thing I will say is the drink does not stay cold long or hot long. But other then that it's a fantastic cup. I will most likely be getting a few more in this style.
customer_reviews.author: Deidre Dyson

customer_reviews.title: Love these!!
customer_reviews.text: I started back to work and needed a bottle for my baby to use since she has been breastfed. I got the regular latch bottle that she was using and them switched her to these when she's was 3 1/2 months old. I tried other brands and they didn't work for her since she ended up throwing up afterwards. I got these to transition her off the bottle and she took to them right away and haven't had any issues with them. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: DakotaS

customer_reviews.title: Win win for EBF babes!
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm! My exclusively breast fed baby would never take a bottle but took this instantly at 4 months! 100% recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda M

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: Love this. My exclusively breastfed baby is picky about pacifiers and hasn't used a bottle or sippy before, he immediately latched onto the sippy with no issues, he is almost 5 months old. I put pumped breastmilk into it to coax him to use the sippy. He doesn't hold it himself yet, but the nipple hasn't caused any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Justthe2ofus

customer_reviews.title: Baby loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our son loves his new cup and is slowly learning how it works! The spout is super malleable too! It's dropped on the floor a number of times and stands up to the challenge with no spills. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: jerem rondina

customer_reviews.title: Useless product
customer_reviews.text: Please discontinue this product. This is the useless product. Leaks from top bottom. Fed up with trying stop many different ways to make it work. Amazon and munchkin please refund my money
customer_reviews.author: Pooja

customer_reviews.title: best cup
customer_reviews.text: usually by your 4th child you've got the sippy cup thing down, my son was born 13 weeks early so we had a real issue finding a sippy he could handle. we purchased 10 different kinds and this one ended up being perfect. it is also very easy to clean. the handles are great for little ones to hold onto. it really helps them learn to tip the cup up to get more liquid.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Leaks from the nipple
customer_reviews.text: Worked very well but started to have major leaking problems. Our son does not have teeth yet and we wash all items by hand. So I know it is not due to dishwasher or teething. But cup leaks from the tip enough for us to no longer use the cup.
customer_reviews.author: austin

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat durable
customer_reviews.text: My daughter would never take a bottle, but liked using these! The only downside is the spout is breaking and they don't sell replacement spouts and I don't want to buy a whole new cup just for a spout 👎🏻 But it lasted us from 4mo-8mo or so before the spout took a turn
customer_reviews.author: Abigail Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Not an easy transition from a bottle
customer_reviews.text: The cup is really easy to hold and leak proof which is nice but the nipple is very wide so it’s a hard transition from bottle to sippy cup. You also have to bite the nipple a little for the juice (or whatever is inside) to actually come out so we haven’t been successful in using it at all
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing cup
customer_reviews.text: My 5 month old quickly became friends with it, thanks to the very ergonomic handles and soft spout. Now, 3 month later we still love it. Also I would like to mention that this cup been through some harsh days and games - still no leak detected.
customer_reviews.author: Yusif

customer_reviews.title: Okay bottle
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended for my baby's first bottle at 6 months old. Easy to grab with the handles but he just likes to chew on it he can't figure out how to tilt his head back to drink out of it. I tried for a few weeks. She also shakes it a lot and water goes everywhere
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: So smart that the handles fit on all the Munchkin Latch bottles so my buddy can use the handles with a bottle nipple or this sippy! Be warned, the valve on the bottom will leak until the seal is set by baby sucking (or you squeeze the nipple as you put it on so it sucks air).
customer_reviews.author: Anna Joy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Won't line up when screwing together!
customer_reviews.text: I hated this sippy cup so much that I forced it upon my day care provider and bought one with a straw instead. No matter how hard you try to get the sippy part to line up so that the handles make sense, you cannot. So confusing for the poor baby to try to hold and drink when the spout is at 4 o'clock! I hate this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M Spoon

customer_reviews.title: My baby loves this cup!
customer_reviews.text: This is literally the only cup that my 10 month old has been able to use since 6 months old he refuses to use anything else he drops it on the constantly and I've never had an issue with it breaking cracking or anything
customer_reviews.author: Kandice Tice

product_meta.title: Munchkin Latch Transition Cup, Colors May Vary, 4 Ounce
product_meta.description:
Size:4 Ounce (Pack of 1)Transitioning from a bottle to a cup can be difficult, but the new munchkin latch transition trainer helps make it easier. This cup features a flexible soft spout that moves with baby. It's two side handles make it easy for baby to hold and the snug fit lid means it is also spill proof, to avoid mess when on the go.

BRAND STORY
By Munchkin
feature_bullets: Soft silicone spout is gentle on little mouths and flexible so it moves with baby
Removable, ergonomic handles for little hands
Anti colic valve prevents air bubbles to reduce gas and fussiness
Snug fit lid for on the go
Soft silicone spout is gentle on little mouths and flexible so it moves with baby
Removable, ergonomic handles for little hands
Anti colic valve prevents air bubbles to reduce gas and fussiness
Snug fit lid for on the go
